yoruba: Oòrùn, kó tìẹ wọ̀ ká má bàá Ọlọ́jọ́ wí.
gold: Sun, go set so one does not blame the owner of the day.
gen: The Yoruba proverb "Oòrùn, kó tìẹ wọ̀ ká má bàá Ọlọ́jọ́ wí" translates to "Sun, set so that we do not speak ill of the Creator" in English. This proverb suggests that sometimes it is better to let things come to a natural end rather than forcing or complaining about them.
